title: Linux fc-cache Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the Linux fc-cache command and learn how to manage font caches effectively. Discover practical examples to update and troubleshoot font cache issues on your system.

meta.title: Linux fc-cache Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the Linux fc-cache command and learn how to manage font caches effectively. Discover practical examples to update and troubleshoot font cache issues on your system.
meta.keywords: Linux, fc-cache, font cache, font management, system utilities, troubleshooting

verify.name: Verify the font cache was updated
verify.hint: The font cache was not updated correctly. Please ensure you have added the "my-font.ttf" file to the /usr/share/fonts/ directory and run the fc-cache command.

steps.title: Updating the Font Cache with fc-cache

verify.name: Verify the font cache was updated
verify.hint: The font cache was not updated correctly. Please ensure you have added the "another-font.ttf" file to the /usr/share/fonts/ directory and run the fc-cache command.

verify.name: Verify the font cache was rebuilt
verify.hint: The font cache was not rebuilt correctly. Please ensure you have run the fc-cache command to rebuild the font cache.
